WRITING.TITLE: To build taller, sturdier, more portable wind turbines, engineers look to Eiffel-Tower-esque "Space Frame" construction.
Algae in glass cases could determine frackings toll. Scientists trying to use diatoms to measure frackwater pollution.

Scientists gain new info on young sea turtles' "lost years" between hatching and breeding by tracking newborns through Atlantic. Spoiler: They spend time leisurely sunbathing and munching in the open ocean.
The world's soils have lost 50-70% of their carbon to the atmosphere. Here's how we can put it back, save the climate, and boost food production.
The future of rare earth recycling: Companies are scrambling to find ways to reuse costly rare earth elements. Recycling even 10% is a lofty goal.
The world's soils have lost 50-70% of their carbon to the atmosphere. Here's how we can put it back, save the climate, and boost food production.
Harsh winter causing major die-off of invasive insects, researchers find
Seafaring drones could reveal the secret lives of sharks as they gather for their own version of "Burning Man" in the Pacific.
Pine forest vapors form small aerosol particles that may significantly cool the climate.
New tools make it possible to scavenge ambient energy, which, until recently, was largely squandered.

WRITING.TEXT: Seems unbelievable, but the key is the size of the wind farms they modeled. The number of turbines ranged from 78,000 to 540,000. An array that large could slow the winds enough that they wouldn't immediately destroy the turbines themselves.

WRITING.TITLE: New forest map for Sarawak reveals large-scale deforestation, encroachment on indigenous territories
New type of rewritable paper that uses water as ink could slash the amount of paper that's wasted on once-read documents. Costs 99% less than inkjet printing.

Arctic "darkening" -- caused mainly by melting of sea ice -- has a bigger impact on global warming than expected.
Five Questions for Elizabeth Kolbert on Facing Up to the Sixth Extinction -- the human-driven crash of the planet's biodiversity
Room for Debate: Is Keystone Worth the Fight? McKibben and others square off with industry.
The dirty secret media coverage has ignored: The U.S. has its own large ivory trade that's not adequately regulated.
